summary: Provides a command‑line example that loads a citation graph (Cora, Citeseer, Pubmed) with DGL, builds an ARMA‑based graph convolutional neural network using PyTorch, and trains it end‑to‑end for node classification, while the supporting module defines the ARMA layer, its weight initialization, and a time‑series forecasting wrapper.
business_intent: Showcase and benchmark the ARMA graph convolution model on standard citation datasets, offering a reproducible reference implementation for researchers and practitioners to experiment with ARMA‑based GNNs in DGL/PyTorch environments.
